articles.title: 5 takeaways from the Revolution’s season-opening defeat in Nashville
articles.description:
New England has a long way to go under new head coach Marko Mitrović.

The post 5 takeaways from the Revolution’s season-opening defeat in Nashville appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: New England Revolution lost 2-0 to Nashville SC in their season opener on February 22.
Head coach Marko Mitrović faces challenges in improving team performance this season.
Local fans express concerns about the team's competitiveness in the MLS Eastern Conference.

articles.title: New Commuter Rail fare gates at South Station break down again
articles.description:
The fare gates have now been closed twice due to harsh winter conditions since they opened late last year.

The post New Commuter Rail fare gates at South Station break down again appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: New fare gates at South Station have closed twice due to winter conditions since late 2022.
The gates' repeated breakdowns disrupt commuter travel for thousands of Boston residents.
Harsh winter weather continues to challenge infrastructure reliability in Boston's transit system.

articles.title: Watch: Jack Hughes delivers USA first Olympic gold medal in men’s hockey since 1980
articles.description:
Team USA defeated Canada, 2-1, in Sunday's gold medal game.

The post Watch: Jack Hughes delivers USA first Olympic gold medal in men’s hockey since 1980 appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Team USA won Olympic gold in men's hockey, defeating Canada 2-1 on February 22.
Jack Hughes, a Boston native, played a crucial role in securing the victory.
This marks the first Olympic gold for USA men's hockey since 1980, boosting local pride.

articles.title: ICE begins to purchase warehouses, but some owners are backing out of deals
articles.description:
New Hampshire Republican Gov. Kelly Ayotte sparred with federal officials after ICE disclosed plans to spend $158 million to convert a warehouse in Merrimack into a 500-bed processing center.

The post ICE begins to purchase warehouses, but some owners are backing out of deals appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: ICE plans to spend $158 million on a 500-bed processing center in Merrimack, NH.
New Hampshire Gov. Kelly Ayotte criticized federal officials over the warehouse conversion plans.
Local property owners are reconsidering deals, impacting ICE's expansion efforts in the region.

articles.title: After homering in spring training debut, could Andruw Monasterio play big role for Red Sox in 2026?
articles.description:
Andruw Monasterio earned some high praise from Alex Cora earlier in spring training as well.

The post After homering in spring training debut, could Andruw Monasterio play big role for Red Sox in 2026? appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Andruw Monasterio homered in his spring training debut for the Red Sox.
Manager Alex Cora praised Monasterio's performance earlier in spring training.
Monasterio's potential role in 2026 could influence Red Sox's future roster decisions.

articles.title: MSP arrests Maine man after he allegedly crashed truck twice while on drugs
articles.description:
The man crashed early Thursday morning at a rest area in Bridgewater, then crashed a second time an hour later in Westport, according to police.

The post MSP arrests Maine man after he allegedly crashed truck twice while on drugs appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: MSP arrested a Maine man for crashing his truck twice on February 22.
The first crash occurred at a Bridgewater rest area, followed by a second in Westport.
Local residents are concerned about drug-related incidents affecting road safety.

articles.title: ICE’s purchases for big detention centers are marked by secrecy, frustrating towns
articles.description:
ICE, which is part of DHS, has purchased at least seven warehouses in Arizona, Georgia, Maryland, Pennsylvania and Texas, signed deeds show.

The post ICE’s purchases for big detention centers are marked by secrecy, frustrating towns appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: ICE has acquired seven warehouses across five states for detention centers.
Locations include Arizona, Georgia, Maryland, Pennsylvania, and Texas.
Local communities express frustration over lack of transparency in ICE's operations.
